Category.Entry: "Fills your arteries with gunk, fills your soul with happiness."
An excellent source of potassium and naughty humor.
Eases your pain in more ways than one.
Some sort of crazy magical video game first aid kit that can heal your wounds in a split second.
"C'mon, go ham sammich! Your booty will resemble two planets!"
"They make you look cool. C'mon, have one! All the other kids are doing it!"
"Speeds you up. Which is ironic, considering it also makes you fat. (Though not in this game.)"
"Want to get buff? Or rather, get A buff? The answer is Muscly Pills. Makes your melee attacks temporarily stronger."
Who knows what effect this mysterious liquid will have on your body?
Probably going to be removed from the game!
"Probably belongs in a much more medieval fantasy-oriented game, but who cares? Increases your Melee strength."
Reduces bullet damage while it lasts. Also makes you look toootally bloated.
"Word up, this will protect your junk."
"Protects you from burns, but leaves you vulnerable to sideburns, so watch out!"
Protects your nose and face from noxious gases. Useful on car trips with your Uncle Denny.
"Useless! Don't tell me when I'm angry, I already know, dammit!"
"Send your opponents on a ""trip"" to ground town."
"The all-purpose handy-dandy rock. Seriously, you'd be surprised how many uses this has."
Create fire in your hand. Probably would have gotten you burned at the stake in the middle ages.
"Can be used as a weapon, but it can also unlock certain things at a durability cost."
Works best when combined with a cigarette lighter. Can be refilled at Ammo Dispenser. Should not be ingested by children under 5.
Single-use device that will hack into any computer remotely.
Gives you just about any item your little heart desires.
Unlocks a single door in the location where you retrieved it.
Remotely hack any computer like the l337 h4x0r you are. You can move while hacking to avoid detection. 50% chance of causing an alarm.
Pick any lock. Just don't expect the owner of said lock to appreciate it.
"Give it a rub, you know you want to!"
"Keeps your food nice and fresh, giving you a health bonus on food that you eat as long as this is in your inventory."
Unlocks a single safe in the location where you retrieved it. Why the owner carried this in their pocket is beyond me.
Infinite-use tool that unlocks any safe.
"Hit people, dig up graves, and participate in all sorts of other not-at-all unsavory activities."
"Teleports you to a random location, getting you out of a jam and potentially into a new one."
"Translates Gorilla/Alien/Beast/Whatever speak into any language, except for one: The language of love."
Turns one hapless victim into your puppet.
"Whether used as a weapon or tampering tool (which costs durability), the wrench is a fine companion."
Increases Firearms attribute when using any projectile weapon that it's attached to.
"Attach to any gun, so you can kill without waking the neighbors, which would be super rude!"
"Extinguishes all flames, except for the flames of desire in your heart. Unless you point it down your throat."
"Pyromaniacs rejoice! With this weapon, you can burn down certain walls and objects."
Freezes people into beautiful human ice sculptures.
"Causes extreme noise pollution, aggravating bedroom programmers the world over. But in this game, it creates a huge gust of wind."
Got a crappy aim? No worries! Just spray bullets everywhere! Bystanders? What bystanders?!
Standard shooty weapon thing. You know the drill.
Blow holes in just about anything-- yourself included if you're not careful.
"Slow, but packs a decidedly tremendous wallop."
Who says water pistols are just for water? Combine this with anything that causes Status Effects. Good times.
Use this to 'axe' people the question 'do you want to die?'
"Beat the crap out of jerks, or play the least exciting sport in the world. The choice is yours!"
"Only use this on trees, ok? That's what it's meant for. Definitely don't use it on humans, are we clear?"
"Intended to help create delicious meals that bring people joy, but you won't be doing any of that, will you?"
Keep the peace by bashing people's skulls in.
Powerful enough to destroy things that other weapons can't.
A favorite of cosplayers and nerds. Also kills things.
Shuts down electronics of all varieties.
"Named for the popular European egg-based video game hero. Coincidentally, also causes dizziness."
Play a silly prank on people by placing this in their path.
"Keeps those slaves in line! If they try to remove it, BOOM! Can also be triggered via remote, so don't wander!"
"Ooo-rah! This helmet will protect you from everything, from bullets to bird poop. Hoo-ray!"
"Protects you from being injured on the job, but it won't protect you from the fashion police. Oh snap...?"
Blows up the Slave Helmet. Slavemasters can use this 3 times per level.
"Drinking this will cause a person to rage at anyone in their path, causing a ridiculous hullabaloo."
"They say that if you find a Bigfoot and beat it open pinata-style, its insides will be filled with treasure!"
Infinite-use tool that opens any door. But JUST doors. It won't open your heart. Not this key.
"""Resurrects dead hair, amongst other things."" Namely, a human being. From death. Just drink it BEFORE you die."
"Get ready for a HUGE explosion 10 seconds after placing this. Like, seriously. Move faaaar back."
"When your health drops below a certain point, you'll be teleported somewhere else."
"Removes windows completely, while only making a tiny amount of noise."
Step 1: Move behind enemy. Step 2: Use chloroform. Step 3: ...Profit?
"A silent gun that plants a tiny, unnoticeable dart in your enemies. 10 seconds later, it's naptime."
"Turns almost any item into ""food""... Food that probably causes cancer, but that's beyond the game's scope."
Turns almost any item into ammunition that's spread amongst the projectile weapons in your inventory.
Play some jammin' tunes and distract your enemies by sending them into spontaneous dance.
Warps you to the next floor.
"You now own every piece of property on this floor. Come and go as you please, free of repercussions."
"Warps you approximately 32 pixels in the direction you're facing, if there's room. Teleport through walls!"
Temporarily destroys the hearing of everyone on the floor. Give them the peace and quiet they deserve!
"Simultaneously avoid detection by security beams, and look like the coooolest kid on the block."
Safely remove explosive helmets from slaves' heads by interacting with them.
Increase any piece of armor's durability to 200%.
Increase any melee weapon's durability to 200%.
"Has literally nothing to do with small rodents, but does increase your chance of scoring a critical hit to 100%."
"Gives you a ridiculous static charge, injuring anyone who comes in contact with your body."
"Didn't drink enough milk as a child? No matter, the Giantizer will make you freakishly huge."
"Normally, you'd need to be up all night to get lucky. With this, you'll have better luck all the time! (insert groan)"
"Luckier than the Four-Leaf Clover, less lucky than the fabled Six-leaf clover. The awkward middle child."
The big daddy of clovers. Put Lady Luck into a chokehold and make her cry uncle.
"Use this on someone to make them like you. I mean, not LIKE like, but.. you know. Just friends!"
Use this on someone to make them align with you. Because everyone needs somebody to lean on.
"Causes a person to hate the first person they see. Because haters gonna hate. Fortunately, you're the player."
"Stand behind your victim and use this to steal from their pocket, like the sticky bandit you are"
Redeem at any store to receive a free item of your choosing.
"Help control the population and get paid for it! Kill people, get money. Caps at $100 per level."
Ever wanted to be able to throw things at people and make them explode into giblets? LIVE YOUR DREAMS!!!
Break lamps to find something nice.
Teleports the ammunition from a person's projectile weapon into the projectile weapons that you're carrying.
"Find an augmentation booth and use this to modify yourself, unless you find transhumanism unethical I guess."
Valuable circuitry that could change the world. Or it's from a Nintendo cartridge. Not your job to know.
Contains data that the Resistance purports to need. So it's probably filled with girlie pictures.
"Acts as proof that someone, somewhere has been exterminated. And that's the tooth."
"So you're dead and you want your money to go to your kid's college fund? Nope, it's going to the Resistance!"
The specs for a fantastical invention.
"The Resistance leaders have been involved in many, many, many scandals."
The Resistance leaders would NEVER cheat on their spouses! Help this completely truthful narrative prevail!
The Resistance leaders mistakenly played with this ball and lost it before realizing its value.
No one be bluffin' with the Macguffin Muffin.
Makes you look like a big shot.
"Most people on the floor who previously had no opinion of you, now like you. These happy times end after one floor."
Shrinks you down to roughly the size of Mickey Rooney.
"Shrink your enemies and squash them like bugs. Or just put them outside, it's more humane."
Cause incapacitated bodies to vanish into thin air. Or fat air. Let's not discriminate here.
"Place this on a locked door. Agitate the door in some way. BAM, big explosion that can destroy even steel doors."
Call on your buddies to teleport nearby and help you out of a jam. Or just keep you company.
"While this was likely intended for bears (just speculation), you can use it on humans to hurt them and slow them down."
"As long as you're hiding under this, no one will notice you. Unless you move around. The AI isn't THAT dumb!"
"Before you stick that syringe in your arm, perhaps you should find out what's in it. Now you can! Just combine it with a syringe."
Why are you reading this? Go find the other bombs!

Pretty much the worst thief who has ever lived. Actually dresses in stereotypical burglar garb. Ridiculous. This was done out of tremendous insecurities -- they thought it would make them feel like more of a professional criminal. It didn't. Will the Thief ever conquer their imposter syndrome?

"This beast was raised in a science lab and given experimental drugs that made them hyper-intelligent. Lacks the ability to speak English and smells like your Uncle Denny's used toilet brush, but they're super-fast and ridiculously strong. Hates scientists with a burning passion, a sentiment that goes both ways."

"Has devoted their life to advancing science and torturing gorillas. As a result of the former, the Scientist has acquired a number of fun toys to take on their adventure. While they would probably prefer to be testing these toys on caged gorillas in the name of scientific progress (read: undiagnosed sadism), the Scientist has joined the Resistance due to the Mayor cutting beaker allowances to 1 per laboratory."

"The warmest, gentlest slavemaster one could ever hope to have. Joins fellow Slavemasters each night to serenade their slaves with acapella lullabies. This is followed by mandatory cuddle sessions. As for all the form-fitting leather?.. Well, everybody has their thing, ok?"

"When not administering wedgies, swirlies, and Indian sunburns to nerds, the Jock enjoys running into walls at high speeds. When scientists contended that this behavior destroys brain cells, the Jock passionately argued that it actually RESTORES brain cells, ironically giving more validity to the scientists' claims. Scientists backed down after receiving the most severe purple nurples of their lives."

"Manhandling, smashing, beating -- all in a day's work for the simple-minded but strong-of-heart Wrestler! But in truth, this behavior stems from the Wrestler's severe frustrations with the world. Why has the mayor banned playful roughhousing? Why do so many businesses frown upon shirtlessness? Why do books have all those stupid words in them? AAARRRGH!!!"

"Sucks people's blood not out of absolute necessity, but is actually just a really picky eater. This pickiness extends to the Vampire's social circles. Recently overheard: ""Why does this zombie keep texting me to hang out? It's like, dude, just cause we're both undead doesn't mean we're besties. All you do is whine about politics."""

"Whether expounding on the differences between races or lamenting a recent online date gone hi-lariously bad, the Comedian has no shortage of worldview-expanding and totally non-hacky material. While their jokes can be polarizing at times, the comedian lives to be loved, and won't be happy until everyone laughs DAMMIT!"

"Has ambitions of hacking the planet, but will realistically settle for your parents' webcam. What Hacker worth their weight in salt doesn't want to take down the system? Joining the Resistance was a no-brainer for this societal outcast. Also no-brainers: Cheetos and not showering. .....Stereotypes."

"Everyone loves the friendly Bartender! One of the few people willing to listen to you drone on about how your job is crap, the opposite sex doesn't like you, and you're thinking of 'ending it all in a rain of gunfire and carnage'. Blah blah blah! But the bartender remains understanding and discreet to their core. Fun fact, the Bartender also serves alcohol."

"One of the few true pacifists in this dangerous world. Indeed, the Doctor is very skilled at 'pacifying' people. With chloroform. But business is currently booming, what with all the beating being administered by Cops since the Mayor's new ""Law of the Land"" was put in place. Despite the extra cash flow, the Doctor would rather the streets be safe, and has decided to join the Resistance."

"The Shapeshifter has been sent to Earth for the purpose of causing planet-wide chaos. Unfortunately, the Shapeshifter's earthly appearance is that of a demonic-looking little naked person (it's just pink eye, OK?), which is not really ideal for functioning in society. Fortunately, the Possession Stone allows the Shapeshifter to hop into and out of people's bodies, making life on Earth a whole lot easier!"

"Stealthily moves through the shadows and murders people from behind. One day dreamed of assassinating a president or military leader, but has so far had to settle for rich old ladies and the occasional rich feline heir. Hey, a job's a job! When the Assassin heard about the growing unrest against the mayor, a murderous spirit within was renewed!"

"Follows the Law of the Land unflinchingly, even if it doesn't always make perfect sense. Despite this, the Cop became disenchanted with the current government after a law was passed preventing more than four people from dancing side by side, sadly forcing the Cop's Village People cover group to disband."

"Follows the Law of the Land unflinchingly, even if it doesn't always make perfect sense. Despite this, the Cop became disenchanted with the current government after a law was passed preventing more than four people from dancing side by side, sadly forcing the Cop's Village People cover group to disband."

"Joined the Crepes after witnessing their father being murdered at the hands of a Blahd. Actually, it wasn't a Blahd, it was just a crazed naked man driven insane from a nasty sunburn. The Gangster probably needs to have their vision checked."

"Joined the Blahds after witnessing their father being murdered at the hands of a Crepe. Actually, it wasn't a Crepe, it was just a crazed naked man driven insane after falling into a vat of blueberries. The Gangster probably needs to have their vision checked."

"Is often known for being very critical of their fellow roguelike shopkeepers, referring to their contemporaries who set up shop in the middle of dungeons as ""frigging idiots with no common sense"". Prefers to do business in populated areas that aren't surrounded by deadly monsters."

"The Soldier aspires to fight for the city. Unfortunately there are no wars going on right now. So why not create one? That's where the Resistance comes in. Rather than sitting around twiddling their thumbs, the soldier will now have the opportunity to fight the good fight -- and maybe even commit a few atrocities in the process! Hoo-ah!!!"

"The Zombie doesn't actually want to eat people's brains. I mean, that's pretty gross. However, society expects it. Society also demands that 'normies' try to stab Zombies in the head with an axe. It's a vicious cycle. Zombies also wish that they were cool enough to hang out with Vampires -- but as everyone knows, Vampires can be pretty aloof!"

"""Greed is good! So are drugs!"" This is the motto that the Investment Banker lives by. Predictably, this has led them to significant wealth and a crippling drug addiction... Party party party! It's an extreme lifestyle (and gameplay style) that's not for everyone."

"Up until this point, the Werewolf has only used their powers for two things: 1. Winning high school basketball games, and 2. Viciously mauling people. Werewolf does not consider either of these things to be a worthwhile use of their time, and feels like their life is stuck in a rut. Thanks to the Resistance, they'll hopefully be able to use their powers for some good -- all while having a howl-ingly good time!"

"Starting from nothing, the humble Slum Dweller is willing to rise up and do whatever it takes to make it in this crazy world. This typically involves beating up random people for their cash, and scouring trash barrels for bacon cheeseburgers. A true personification of the American dream!"

"Starting from nothing, the humble Slum Dweller is willing to rise up and do whatever it takes to make it in this crazy world. This typically involves beating up random people for their cash, and scouring trash barrels for bacon cheeseburgers. A true personification of the American dream!"
Firearms increased by a large amount
Every hit is a critical hit
Melee attacks from behind do 2X damage if the victim is not in combat. 10X if you are using Camouflage.
"Can't use weapons, except for some thrown items"
"Can't use any weapons, including thrown items"
"Floor hazards are not triggered, pass by lasers undetected"
Anyone you touch with your body gets electrocuted
Can't hear noises except those extremely close by
Attacks more likely to do critical damage
Attacks more likely to do critical damage
"Crush walls and objects, increased weapon damage"
Gorillas attack on sight. Extra XP for killing Gorillas.
Scientists attack on sight. Extra XP for killing Scientists.
Rival gang members attack on sight
People and cameras can't see you
"Invisible for a short period. Canceled by most actions, and when you bump into people. Cannot be activated in view of non-followers. Successful backstabs retain invisibility."
"Knockback from damage is decreased, firing guns doesn't cause knockback"
"Knockback from damage is increased, more guns cause knockback when fired"
Most people are initially Friendly toward you. Enter some private property without issue
Most people are initially Friendly toward you. Enter some private property without issue
"Business owners want you to leave, humans won't join your party"
Each follower's health can be restored once per floor. Can use Blood Bag
Most people won't join your party
"Detracts 5 health, but freezes Feelin' Alright countdown, and stops Withdrawal health drain"
Bullets damage decreased by a small amount
Gas has no effect on you
"People can crush you, decreased weapon damage, and you can fit in toilets"
A single melee hit kills sleeping people silently
Status effects inflicted on you last longer
Status effects inflicted on you last longer
Status effects inflicted on you don't last as long
Melee strength increased by a large amount
Does things with computers and technology that other people can't
Can't use computers or other complicated tech
Aligned with other Cops. Lose XP by killing or robbing Innocents. Innocents are people who obey The Law of the Land and do not stand in your way on missions.
Knocked out when timer runs down
Try walking around. Just try it.
Easier to knock people through walls
Easier to knock people through walls
Do more damage with your bare fists
Do more damage with your bare fists
A follower will join you at the start of each level
A follower will join you at the start of each level
People don't get angry when you break their possessions or walls
Generic denizens of the city are loyal to you
Lunge a longer distance with melee weapons
Lunge a longer distance with melee weapons
Enemies have more difficulty aiming at you
Enemies have more difficulty aiming at you
"Can't hit most people you are aligned with, and they can't hit you. The same goes for Loyal and Submissive. Melee, touch, and bullets only. Extends to your employees."
Hold [Special] to charge a devastating-ish attack
Press [Special] to perform a lycanthropian lunge
Hold [Special] to charge forward and break stuff. Stopping? You can't.
Walk behind any living person and bite them to gradually steal their health
Serve chilled. Allow 5 seconds for effects to set in.
Throw in any item that causes status effects to create a delish...ish confection.
Works the same as its big brother. Sell inventory items from anywhere.
"Tell a joke to a crowd of people, randomly causing them to like you more or less. You might even gain a groupie. Can't be used multiple times on the same person."
"Invisible for a short period. Canceled by most actions, and when you bump into people. Cannot be activated in view of non-followers. Successful backstabs retain invisibility."
"Serve Cocktails to anyone, like it's your job or something."
Recognizes that everything has a price. Can purchase items from anyone at marked up prices.
Jump into people's bodies when standing behind them
"A runestone from the heavens, this allows you to possess or depossess most humanoids."
"Short stature means you take more damage and inflict less damage, and can fit down toilets"
"A highly inappropriate way to stroll around the city, not to mention illegal. Cops will attack you on sight, business owners want you to leave."
Pick up and throw most objects in the environment
"Cuff people, effectively neutralizing them non-lethally. Cannot be used on 'The Law' or non-humans."
Cops in the current stage ignore your crimes
Blood is the only thing that can restore your health
"On one hand, you can walk through walls. On the other hand, it doesn't matter because YOU'RE DEAD."
Who are you going to call? Hopefully your mother. She misses you. This electrostatic blast works on all supernatural creatures.
Business owners want you to leave
Or Be Eaten By A Grue!
People generally dislike when you plant these in their faces.
Summons the dead to do your bidding. As long as you're close to a graveyard.
Hire someone without paying them. This voucher ensures that the Resistance will compensate them later. Provided they feel like it. Spoiler: They won't.
"As a reward for killing 3 people, your guns will receive ammunition to ensure that the cycle of violence continues!"
Killing people heals you a bit. But it won't heal your tortured soul!
"Creates a blinding flash that reduces people's vision significantly (if temporarily), ensuring a dark future ravaged by stubbed toes."
Paralyzes people temporarily. Looks like a multi-colored upside-down 'P' because a certain game designer was running VERY low on ideas.
"Turn into a Werewolf. 15 seconds of mayhem, followed by paralyzing dizziness."
Stop reading this and go slash some throats!
"Causes you to cry like a little baby. Serves no purpose, except to embarrass you."
"People who have contact with you and die are turned into zombies, who will not attack you"
"People will either run from you, or try to kill you"
Release a powerful burst of acid from your esophagus that costs you 10 health
More mobility when performing melee attacks
More mobility when performing melee attacks
Melee weapons take longer to break
Melee weapons take longer to break
All map markers are filled at the beginning of levels
"Your ""(Doing something)..."" bar fills much more quickly"
"Gain lots of extra XP, earn fewer Chicken Nuggets on level-up"
More traits to choose from when you level up
More traits to choose from when you level up
Gain speed when health is low
Gain speed when health is low
Inflict more damage on enemies when health is low
Inflict more damage on enemies when health is low
Enemies are more likely to run away during battle
Enemies are more likely to run away during battle
Chance to cause Slow when hitting enemies
Chance to cause Slow when hitting enemies
People do not become angry when you steal their property. Does not work when you pickpocket someone.
Distance at which people can see you is reduced
Distance at which people can see you is reduced
Chance to knock an enemy's weapon out of their hands when they are blocking
You're addicted to drugs... all of them. Take any status-effect-causing drug on a regular basis to avoid withdrawal effects.
"Ohhhhhh the pain. You know what will make it all better? DRUGS! Speed, Melee strength and Firearms are affected, and health is lost every 2 seconds."
Life is good when you're on drugs! Until you're not on drugs! Then it's terrible!
"Did you know? Passing gas is good for your health! Gain extra max health, but also gain Extreme Flatulence."
"Fart at inopportune times, giving away your location and thoroughly embarrassing you"
"Get a whole bunch of money... through illegal means. You'll be Wanted, causing law enforcement to go after you."
Law enforcement attacks you on sight
"Taking steroids on the regular makes you super strong, but can cause 'Roid Rage! You'll randomly have uncontrollable angry outbursts."
"The Mayor instituted a ""Friendly Neighbor"" policy where people must legally keep their doors unlocked. But he didn't say anything about Door Detonators."
You want more guns? Have some! But it's only fair that everyone else gets some too (starting next floor). And they're better at using them.
"A random stat gains a point every other level-up, starting with level 2"
A killer robot is out to get you!
Lots of rioters are causing chaos in the streets!
Radiation rains down upon all outdoor areas every 20 seconds!
Bombs are falling from the sky!
Find a bunch of hidden bombs before they decimate the area!
Giants are strolling around like they own the place!
There's a war going on in the streets!
Police have locked down the city. They won't be happy you're out and about!
"Aliens have invaded, and their probing hand is quivering in anticipation!"
All the spooky creatures on the city have come out to scare up some carnage!
"The power is out, and you are likely to be eaten by a Grue!"
"The floor is being fumigated, but who knows what the fumes will do to a human!"
A young scoundrel has booby trapped the entire floor!
Hit squads are patrolling the floor!
Escort a whiny Resistance Leader across the level!
Twitch viewers vote on your reward!
"You'd better pay this back at an ATM or Bank, or face potentially deadly consequences! Also, interest."
"If you don't pay this back at an ATM or Bank before the end of the floor, you might have a problem."
There are killers after you. And not the nice kind. Get rid of them by paying off your debt at an ATM or Bank.
"Borrow money from Drug Dealer, Shopkeeper, Bartender, Clerk, and others at lower interest rates than normal"
"Can't interact with objects or use items, except for food and drinks"
Exchange these for cool stuff in the Home Base.
"Knockback from damage is severely decreased, bullets don't cause knockback"
Always knock an enemy's weapon out of their hands when they are blocking
Receive XP for each object and wall destroyed
Apes have overtaken this sector. Damn them all to hell!
Feast on corpses to gain health
Human meat is the only food that can restore your health. Alcohol works too.

"The result of inbreeding, toxic sludge pollution, and internet videos of animals being kept in tiny cramped spaces before being turned into fast food. The Cannibal finds it morally unjustifiable to eat animal meat, but it's just so tasty! There's only so much tofu one can take before they snap. Fun fact: Human meat is apparently very sweet tasting."
Melee strength increased by a small amount
"Gives your victim a shocking surprise. Be careful around water, this is not a toy!"
"Slap a Slave Helmet on someone who's been electrocuted with the Taser, or is otherwise dizzy. Be careful though, some Slaves may become mutinous!"
"Your ""(Doing something)..."" bar fills much more slowly"
Random people will turn Hostile when they see you. Law enforcement won't care if you retaliate.
"Hold [Special] to charge. Hit a living person and Zombify them, and they'll become your follower. Costs a bit of health."
"Can't hit people of your own class, unless they are Hostile. Melee, touch, and bullets only. Also makes them Friendly."
Hitting non-neutralized opponents with your melee attacks restore health
Hitting non-neutralized opponents with your melee attacks restore health
Clear all Traits that you've enabled
Clear all Items that you've enabled
Blahds will attack on sight. Extra XP for killing Blahds.
Crepes will attack on sight. Extra XP for killing Crepes.
Affords you all the special rights and privileges that 1%-ers so clearly deserve
"Provides servants to everyone who can afford one. As for all the form-fitting leather?.. Well, everybody has their thing, ok?"
"Are you having fun? Lots of fun? Don't let the No-Fun Enforcer know it, or they just might beat you up! Follows the Law of the Land unflinchingly, even if it doesn't always make perfect sense."

"The result of inbreeding, toxic sludge pollution, and internet videos of animals being kept in tiny cramped spaces before being turned into fast food. The Maniac gains their power from sucking the life energy out of dead people, but refuses to eat anything!"
"A terrible disease is spreading throughout the land, causing people to attack other people without provocation!"

"Joined the Crepes after witnessing their mother being murdered at the hands of a Blahd. Actually, it wasn't a Blahd, it was just a naked man with extreme full-body rosacea. And it wasn't a murder, they were just fornicating! The Troublemaker probably needs to have their vision checked."

"Joined the Blahds after witnessing their father being murdered at the hands of a Crepe. Actually, it wasn't a Crepe, it was just a naked woman doing Avatar cosplay. And it wasn't a murder, they were just fornicating! The Troublemaker probably needs to have their vision checked."

"""Greed is good!"" This is the motto that the Investment Banker lives by. Predictably, this has led them to significant wealth. But they are also addicted to power-ups! Party party party! It's an extreme lifestyle (and gameplay style) that's not for everyone."
Keep fun to a minimum by bashing people's skulls in.
"Before you use that Wacky Needle, perhaps you should find out what's in it. Now you can! Just combine it with a Wacky Needle."
"Slap a Servant Helmet on someone who's been electrocuted with the Taser. Be careful though, some Servants may become mutinous!"
"Hold [Special] to charge. Hit a living person and cause them to become Diseased, and they'll become your follower. Costs a bit of health."
"People who have contact with you and die will become the Diseased, and will not attack you"
Use any status-effect-causing item on a regular basis to avoid withdrawal effects.
Use any status-effect-causing item on a regular basis to avoid withdrawal effects.
No-Fun Enforcers in the current stage ignore your crimes
Blows up the Servant Helmet. Servant Providers can use this 3 times per level.
"Borrow money from Street Peddler, Shopkeeper, Bartender, Clerk, and others."
"Cuff people, effectively neutralizing them non-lethally. Cannot be used on 'The Law'."
Aligned with other No-Fun Enforcers. Lose XP by killing or robbing Innocents. Innocents are people who obey The Law of the Land and do not stand in your way on missions.
"Keeps those servants in line! If they try to remove it, BOOM! Can also be triggered via remote, so don't wander!"
Purchase tools from Thieves at discounted prices. Thieves will not steal from you.
Purchase tools from Thieves at discounted prices. Thieves will not steal from you.
"Most people on the floor who previously had no opinion of you, now like you"
Ooze is spreading! Try not to touch and/or lick it!
"A bounty is on the player's head, so random people will attack unexpectedly!"
Players and NPCs get new Status Effects every 10 seconds!

"Fire hoses are pretty effective, but they're so big and unwieldy! So, what's a more efficient solution? According to the Mayor: chop off the arms of Firefighters and install state-of-the-art Water Cannons on the nub. While this has led to a moderate improvement in fire control effectiveness, it has caused Firefighter morale to plummet, what with all the unwanted mutilation and such."
"Fights back fires and rowdy crowds. Can be refilled at Fire Hydrants or bodies of water. Only accepts 100% pure, non-toxic water."

"The Mobster lives by several guiding principles: Cash is king, family is forever, and dinner is divine. Breaking this balanced trifecta of money, loyalty, and heaping helpings of carbohydrates would make for one cranky criminal. With mayoral power, cash and noodles are guaranteed to flow freely for the Mobster and their clan."
Revenue is earned by extorting business owners and paid at the start of levels

"Mug people for cash or important items. Also increases your general ""threaten"" abilities and allows you to talk to Annoyed people."
"Mug people for cash or important items. Also increases your general ""threaten"" abilities and allows you to talk to Annoyed people."

"Most Robots have specific roles, like ""Cop"", or ""Butler"", but sadly the engineers behind this Robot forgot to give it a purpose. Combine this with an uncommonly low battery life, and you've got a formula for an inferiority complex. However, since joining the Resistance the Robot has seemingly found their purpose: Become Mayor and bring about judgment day. Or alternatively, discover what love is, and rule with benevolence."
Releases a blast of energy that recharges you if it hits most electronic devices
Power Sap gives you more health from electronic devices
Power Sap does more damage to people in its radius
"Your melee, firearms and speed attributes start very high, and get lower along with your battery"
"Your melee, firearms and speed attributes start very high, and get lower along with your battery"

"The Bouncer has finally hit pay dirt, having been hired by a major record label to escort one of their biggest stars to Mayor Village. Unfortunately, the pair have gotten off on the wrong foot, following a heated argument about whether nu-metal is dead or just hibernating. This resulted in the Bouncer picking up a cookie and threatening to do something very vulgar with it ""Bizkit style"". Will these two mismatched partners ever see eye to eye?"
"You are responsible for the well-being of an extremely important Musician who will follow you everywhere, and probably not cause any trouble whatsoever"
Gives you a li'l zap when you stray too far from the Musician.
Transfer your life force to someone of more significance. Use this to heal or revive the Musician.
Stomp the ground to make everyone in the nearby radius Dizzy

"In a world where teleportation is a thing, why would anyone need a Courier to deliver packages by hand? Simple: sometimes, items can shift around in weird ways during teleportation. Not like The Fly or anything like that, more along the lines of gravy from your brisket spilling all over your fries. If you wanted poutine, you'd have have ordered poutine!"
"Faster than shoes, less cool than a skateboard, more disco-fabulous than ice skates."
"Faster than shoes, less cool than a skateboard, more disco-fabulous than ice skates."
Get the package from point A to point B without teleporting or taking too much damage. Stop reading this and MOOOVE!
Get your side hustle on with Guuber! Use the app to start taking deliveries.
Don't teleport with this or take too much damage!
"Oof, nice going. Someone's going to get one-starred."

"Working for the Mayor as an anonymous Goon has its drawbacks. For starters, their life consists of waiting around for some reckless oaf from the Resistance to try and ""neutralize"" them for unspecified reasons. However, the Goon has recently done some soul searching and had a major revelation: What if they WERE that reckless oaf?"

"After crash landing in the city, the Alien took one look around and exclaimed ""UiMeRmo bOdEgIz"", which translates roughly to ""I feel really sick from that flight, but I'm going to try to hold in my stomach so as not to make a bad first impression."" The effort was a failure. Fortunately, the Resistance took pity on the Alien despite the terrible faux pas, and is helping them get back to their home planet."
"Can't use weapons, and fist attacks cause only 1 damage"
"Can't use weapons, and fist attacks do not cause any damage"
Shoots a blast of mind-melting energy. Anyone within its radius will begin to mimic your movements. Use a second time to relinquish your grip on these poor NPCs.

"Being nice doesn't always get the job done. The Mech Pilot takes a zero-tolerance approach to cleaning up the city, acting as judge, jury, and executioner... Mostly executioner. OK, pretty much entirely executioner. Having already gained a reputation for their unique brand of street justice, the city's undesirables are ready to take on this hulking grim reaper, while the city's law enforcers are ready to ignore you in favor of making their lives easier."
Jump into a Mech when you're standing next to it

"Why build when you can destroy? "Chance to spawn, 0% to 100%. It's a little finicky. Examples: If you wanted something to have a 75% chance of spawning on all difficulty levels, you'd set the boxes to ""75, 0, 0"" or ""75, 75, 75"". If you wanted something to have an 80% chance to spawn on difficulty 2 but NOT 3, you'd set it to ""0, 80, 0"". If you want something to have a 50% chance to spawn on difficulty 2 but 100% on difficulty 3, you'd use ""0, 50, 100""."

"Objects and NPCs classified as ""Important"" can potentially be chosen for use in missions. For example, a chest marked as ""Important"" might be used in a ""Retrieve Item"" mission. An imprisoned person marked as ""Important"" might be chosen for a ""Rescue"" mission. An owner marked as important might be chosen for a ""Neutralize"" mission. NPCs marked as ""Important"" might also become questgivers."

"Numeric value indicating ownership. Any objects, walls or floors with a matching ""Owned By"" ID will be owned by this NPC. An NPC with an Owner ID of 99 will treat all owned property in the chunk as their own."

"Numeric value indicating ownership. Any NPC with a matching ""Owner ID"" will own this. Objects and walls will automatically take the ID of the floor below them, unless a new owner is specified for that object."
"Walls marked with this will have a 50% chance of spawning, even when they have the same ""Multiple in Chunk"" ID as other nearby walls"

"Numeric value. Objects with matching IDs will spawn ""the same"" as all other objects with this ID. For example, if you chose ""Strong Walls"" as your wall type (which chooses randomly between the wall types ""Normal"" and ""Steel""), and you placed a bunch of walls WITHOUT a ""Multiple in Chunk"" ID, some of your walls would be Normal, and some would be Steel. On the other hand, if you gave the walls a matching ""Multiple in Chunk"" ID, all of the walls would spawn as Normal, or all would spawn as Steel."

"""Prisons"" are essentially any area on owned property where the player is not allowed to go. The numeric ""Prison ID"" value can be placed on any of the different floor layers. Values higher than 0 indicate that the floor tile is a prison. Floor tiles underneath the surrounding prison walls should be given a prison ID. If a chunk has multiple prisons, be sure to give different Prison IDs to the floor tiles for each prison."

"Numeric value from 0 to 2 showing the layer of the floor tile. You could technically have a tile with ""Layer 2"" on ""Floor 1"", but you should probably keep these to their default values to avoid confusion."
"Direction the object is facing. Defaults to South, but objects next to walls will often automatically face the correct direction if left blank."

"Alphanumeric value. If you only want an object to appear once on an entire level, give a matching value to every object of this type in every chunk. When the level loads, only one of those objects will appear."
"Starting goal for an NPC. If left blank, the game will choose an appropriate goal based on the NPC's circumstances."

"""None"" means a person won't care if you enter their property. ""Hostile"" will cause them to become hostile when you enter. A value of 2 will cause them to tell you to leave, but they won't immediately become hostile. (NPCs will always be hostile if you enter their owned Prison tiles)"

"Numeric value determining the numbered order of a Patrol Point. For example, an NPC would walk from a Patrol Point with value 1, to 2, to 3, etc. Upon reaching the end of the sequence, the NPC walks back to the point with value 1."
"Numeric value determining the size of the light in the ""Full"" lighting setting."
"Numeric value determining the size of the light in the ""Medium"" lighting setting. If left at 0, the game will attempt to size the light correctly based on the ""Full"" lighting setting."
"Light will only appear when the player's lighting is set to ""Full"". If both boxes are unchecked, the light will appear under both settings."
"Light will only appear when the player's lighting is set to ""Med""."
Rotates the next chunk that you place 90 degrees counter-clockwise
Flips the next chunk that you place horizontally or vertically
"Locked doors should be given a Direction facing the interior of the room. For example, for a door at the South end of a room, Direction = North"
"If you want owner NPCs to drop a key for a locked door, make sure that the floor beneath the door has a Prison ID."
"The appearance of some floor tiles may change based on the current District, or not appear in some districts."
"Some floor tiles may have additional effects . For example, Flame Pit may spawn with a Fire attached to it."
Contents of the chunk are randomized when the level loads

"When selected, the game will automatically place these objects into the level. Press the ""District Defaults"" button to enable the appopriate objects for your currently selected district."
"Chunk descriptions are used when the game is determining which chunks to randomly place into a level. For example, the game wouldn't place a Private Club into a Slums level."

"Chunk special types are used when the game is determining which chunks to randomly place into a level. For example, if a chunk was surrounded by walls on three sides, the game might place a chunk with special type ""Dead End"""
"Difficulty setting affects NPC spawn chance (see the 3 ""Spawn Chance"" settings when placing an NPC), as well as other factors, such as what weapon the NPC carries."

"If set to Yes, the level structure will be randomized, and all other settings (Features, Disasters, etc.) will be kept. This is useful if you want to place a randomized level with unique settings into your campaign."
"If set to No, you will need to assign missions to chunks yourself. If set to Yes, the game will determine an optimal set of missions for the level."
"During gameplay, the game will attempt to assign your chosen mission to the selected chunk. If this is not possible, the game will attempt to assign another mission type to the chunk."
